_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Background Data

In accordance with title 40 of the code of Federal Regulations chapter 68 (40 CFR 68) promulgated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Sara Lee Corporation - Greenville, SC submits this risk Management Plan (RMP) for operations at their Greenville, SC facility.  Sara Lee Corporation - Greenville, SC facility makes bagels and frozen dough products.  The major processes at the Greenville facility include flour handling and storage, ingredient mixing, dough proofing, bread baking, dough freezing and product packaging and distribution.  Raw materials are delivered to this facility by trucks.  

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Sara Lee Corporation - Greenville, SC is committed to protecting the health of its employees the surrounding community, and the environment; therefore it is Sara Lee Corporation - Greenville, SC policy to mange a safe and healthy workplace, protect the environment, and maintain compliance with safety, health, and environmental regulations:  40 CFR 68 as well as occupational Safety and Health Organization (OSHA) Process Safety management (PSM) regulations promulgated as Title 29 of the Code of Federal Regulations Chapter 1910, Section 119 (29 CFR 1910.119), and OSHA's Hazardous Operations and Emergency Response Regulation (29 CFR 1910.120).

Stationary Source and Regulated Substances 

Sara Lee Corporation - Greenville, SC uses anhydrous ammonia (a 112(r) regulated substance) as a refrigerant to manufacture and store product within the required range of operating temperatures.  Anhydrous ammonia is an industry-standard refrigerant for food processing plants.  Sara Lee Corporation - Greenville, SC refrigeration system consists of receivers, compressors, evaporators, condensers, and piping in an engineered closed loop system.

Accidental Release Prevention Program

Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration system is designed and constructed in accordance with ANSI/IIAR 2-19

92 Standards for Equipment, Design and Installation of Ammonia Mechanical Refrigeration systems.  To prevent and mitigate accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia, Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC has implemented several precautionary measures, such as process/equipment controls, standard operation procedures, preventative maintenance programs, employee training and audit programs

Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC maintains a A?no odorA? policy.  The A?no odorA? policy instructs employees that detect an ammonia odor to call the Refrigeration Technicians who must respond immediately to the call to address the situation.

Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC has implemented and is in compliance with OSHAA?s PSM regulations and as such, has evaluated and engineered for anhydrous ammonia releases.  Some of the controls installed to prevent catastrophic releases of ammonia are process equipment (vents, pressure relief valves, backup pumps, and manual shutoffs) and automated controls (automatic shut-offs, ammonia leak detection systems, and electrical distribution system grounding).  In addition, Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC has trained approximately 24 personnel to respond to potential ammonia releases (HazMat team).

Sara Lee Corporation - Greenville, SC has developed Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for all employees and contractors that have contact with the ammonia refrigeration system that incorporate safety measures into the procedures.  These safety procedures were developed by refrigeration system operators and are reviewed on an annual basis by means of an SOP review session.  Process safety information for the refrigeration system is reviewed during these annual meetings as well.  Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC encourages employee participation in development of the control measure used at the plant by means of the annual procedures review.  Any changes to the operating procedures are communicated to affected employees followi

ng written management of change procedures established by Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC.

Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC understands that maintaining the refrigeration system in good working order is essential to preventing accidental releases; therefore Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC has implemented a preventative maintenance (PM) program.  The preventative maintenance program is scheduled, documented and managed to ensure that regular maintenance occurs on the refrigeration system.  Also, to ensure the mechanical integrity of critical refrigeration system components, auditing is conducted every 5 years by a certified refrigeration contractor.

To ensure that Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC control measure are effective in maintaining the safe operation of the plant, regularly scheduled audits are performed on the ammonia refrigeration system:
A?    In accordance with the PSM program, Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC conducts detailed PSM compliance audits every three years that incorporate review of process safety information, process hazard analysis operating procedures, training programs, system mechanical integrity, management of change, pre-start up review procedures, compliance audit procedures, and contractor safety procedures.
A?    In addition, Sara Lee Corporation A?Greenville, SC is subject to auditing by the local fire department, OSHA and the Environmental Protection Agency.

Five-Year Accident History

Over the last five years, Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC has not experienced an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia causing any on-site death, injury or significant property damage, or known off-site death, injury, property damage, environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.

Emergency Response Program

Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC has developed a comprehensive emergency response program designed to protect both employees and the community in the event of a release.  This program is ful

ly described in a document entitled Facility Emergency Response Plan (FERP) in order to facilitate response efforts in the event of off-site releases of anhydrous ammonia.  Included in the ERSPCC are measures to be taken internally the Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC as well as measure to be taken by off-site response agencies.

Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC has trained approximately XX on-site personnel to respond to accidental releases of regulated substances.  These personnel are trained in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.120, OSHAA?s Hazardous Operations and Emergency Response regulations according to their duties and function.  These personnel receive initial training and annual update training thereafter.  Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC stages mock release incidents annually to test the skills of the HazMat team, determine the teamA?s readiness, and identify areas of improvement.

To assure that the local governmental response agencies are familiar with Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC emergency response procedures, Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC has submitted copies of the FERP for review and approval by the local agencies.  The following local agencies have reviewed Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC FERP

Greenville County Office of Emergency Management (LEPC)
SCSERC EPCRA Reporting Point (Bureau of Air Quality)
Gantt Fire Department
Hazardous Materials Response Team

To pre-plan for an anhydrous ammonia release with off-site effects, Sara Lee Corporation A? Greenville, SC ERSPCC includes procedures/equipment to mitigate the release, procedures to inform local response agencies, evacuation procedures, and procedures for public communication.

In the event of an anhydrous ammonia release with off-site effects, the general public will be warned by the Local Emergency Planning committee (LEPC) according to the facilityA?s off-site plan which is updated on an annual basis by the LEPC. Any significant changes to the ERSPCC w

ill communicated to the agencies listed above.

Continuous Efforts to Improve Safety

No changes to the ammonia refrigeration process are planned at this time.  However, the process will be subjected to regular process hazard analyses reviews for the purpose of identifying and implementing potential improvements.  Facility and Corporate personnel will also periodically review all potential opportunities to improve the safety of our personnel, the surrounding community, and the ammonia refrigeration process.
